duties_responsibilities.duty: Plan, execute, and complete projects with assigned customers in a safe and cost-effective manner.
Performs or delegates tasks required to execute and fully complete projects including hardware design, system programming, installation coordination, and project closeout.
Coordinates communication with the customer during all phases of the project.
Provides work direction to subcontractors, electrical installers, technicians, designers, and administration as necessary.
Ensures work performed is in compliance with legal requirements and operates on the job with the highest of ethics.
Completes typical installation hardware design and software programming using established standards as required.
Evaluates the contractual scope of work and the impact of client-issued bulletins, field directives, and/or scheduling changes.
Manages the selection, ordering, budget, and delivery schedule of materials for the projects assigned. Secures pricing and availability from outside vendors and suppliers.
Oversees subcontractor payment and billing processes.
Ensures installation is in accordance with project requirements, manages and completes the loading, device verification, and commissioning of all system controllers as required.
Provides coaching, mentoring, and technical assistance to System Technicians, Electrical Installers, and System Designers.
Provides accurate project as-built and commissioning documentation.
Develops project plans and coordinates the required resources to ensure timely and cost-effective installation and completion of assigned projects.
Performs site-specific training for owner/operator on the total system with assistance.
Develops and maintains viable long-term relationships with contractors, clients, consultants, and subcontractors.
Coordinates with Project Engineers on bundled jobs to deliver cost-efficient solutions that exceed customer expectations.
Follows all safety standards and has the highest regard for employee and subcontractor safety.

education_certification.credential: Technical Associates Degree with four years of field experience or six years of equivalent related field experience in the industry.
